entities.name: WEB-BUILDING
entities.description: The process by which spiders construct their webs, involving the selection of a location, production of silk, and construction of the web structure

entities.name: SILK
entities.description: A material produced by spiders from specialized glands called spinnerets, known for its strength and elasticity

entities.name: SPINNERETS
entities.description: Specialized glands located at the rear of a spider's abdomen that produce silk

entities.name: RADIAL LINES
entities.description: The framework lines of a spider's web, spaced at regular intervals to form the basic shape of the web

entities.name: SPIRAL LINES
entities.description: The sticky lines of a spider's web, laid down in a circular pattern to trap prey

entities.name: TRAP LINE
entities.description: A thick strand of silk in a spider's web that serves as a signal line, alerting the spider to the presence of prey

relations: Spiders are the organisms that engage in the process of web-building
The process of web-building involves the production and use of silk
The process of web-building includes the construction of radial lines as the framework of the web
The process of web-building includes the construction of spiral lines to trap prey
The process of web-building includes the placement of a trap line to signal the presence of prey
Spiders produce silk from their spinnerets
Spiders use spinnerets to produce silk
Radial lines form the framework on which spiral lines are laid
Spiral lines and the trap line work together to alert the spider to the presence of prey
The trap line alerts spiders to the presence of prey
